importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the time of the news announcement regarding Daniel Naroditsky's death.
The year Naroditsky won the Under 12 world championship, a key milestone in his early career and development as a prodigy.
The year he graduated with a bachelor's degree in history from Stanford University after taking a year off to compete in tournaments.
The date he won the U.S. National Blitz Championship, highlighting a recent achievement in his career.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from 2007 to 2025 covers Naroditsky's entire professional career, from early achievements at age 12 to his final public appearances and death at age 29.

keyTakeAways: Daniel Naroditsky was a chess grandmaster who began as a child prodigy and rose to prominence in American chess, especially through livestreaming and educational content.
He won the Under 12 world championship in 2007 and became a grandmaster at age 18, maintaining top rankings in both traditional and blitz chess.
Naroditsky was widely recognized for his live streaming and commentary, which brought chess to a global audience on platforms like YouTube and Twitch.
He earned a bachelor's degree in history from Stanford University in 2019 and later coached junior players in Charlotte, North Carolina.
He died at age 29 in October 2025, with the cause of death not immediately known, sparking widespread grief among the global chess community.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Daniel Naroditsky, an American chess grandmaster born in California to Ukrainian and Azerbaijani immigrant parents, died at 29 in October 2025. A child prodigy who won the Under 12 world championship in 2007 and became a grandmaster at 18, Naroditsky maintained top global rankings in both traditional and blitz chess. He gained widespread influence by livestreaming matches and providing educational commentary on YouTube and Twitch, helping to popularize chess among a global, digital audience. After earning a bachelorâ€™s degree in history from Stanford University in 2019, he coached junior players in Charlotte, North Carolina. His death, announced by the Charlotte Chess Center, has deeply affected the chess community, with fellow grandmasters like Hikaru Nakamura and Benjamin Bok expressing admiration for his passion, education-focused approach, and lasting impact on the game.
title: American chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky dies at 29
